function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Using ai algorithms to design new molecules or repurpose drugs may lead to unforeseen side effects or interactions with existing medications.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Sharing vast amounts of treatment data globally using ai tools may raise concerns about data privacy and security.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on ai for diagnosis and treatment decision-making may lead to misinterpretation of medical data and incorrect clinical decisions.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on ai-based prediction models for pandemic forecasting","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of ai for patient management and monitoring","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ai-facilitated drug discovery for covid-19 treatment","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on ai-algorithms for identification of suspected cases and high-risk groups may lead to misclassification or false negatives.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on ai-driven tools for accurate detection of covid-19 may lead to missed diagnoses and delayed treatment for individuals with other types of respiratory diseases.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on smart city data network and terminal tracking systems may lead to privacy concerns and misuse of personal data.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential over-reliance on ai for disease diagnosis and patient positioning, leading to reduced human oversight and interaction","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on cross-population train/test-based ai models for virus detection","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Utilization of deep-learning prediction models for risk stratification in resource-limited settings","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contagious disease covid-19 propagation","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Literature search may have missed relevant articles due to specific search terms or exclusion criteria.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inaccurate data extraction and synthesis leading to incorrect conclusions and recommendations.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Language and communication barriers may lead to exclusion of valuable non-english articles that contain important insights.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Dependence on ai-driven tools for clinical, epidemiological, and public health data may lead to errors or biases in decision-making.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited use of ai in lmics may perpetuate health inequalities and increase the burden on healthcare systems in those countries.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential for reliance on ai to overlook contextual and cultural factors in disease control and treatment, leading to suboptimal outcomes in certain communities.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Failure of existing health systems to prevent massive disruption caused by covid-19","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate processing and integration of clinical, epidemiological, and genetic data","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to optimize health care research in ongoing pandemics","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential lack of public and professional awareness of germicidal uv technology and its efficacy.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate training and certification of uv technicians.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of research on time-motion exposure to apply current uv exposure guidelines effectively.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Insufficient dosing due to ambiguous guidelines for uv fixture deployment","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inadequate air changes per minute in the upper room","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Far uv dosing not confined to the upper room","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Measles is a highly infectious respiratory virus believed to be predominantly airborne, increasing the risk of widespread transmission in built environments.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited pathogen reductions through air disinfection measures, such as uv, result in less than 1 log of risk reduction, which may be insufficient for effective control of airborne pathogens.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The south african study demonstrated that achieving greater protection from airborne pathogens through air changes ach became increasingly challenging, with smaller increments in protection requiring significantly higher equivalent air changes.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Low"}]}
